description: From Middle English reuler; equivalent to rule +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: A (usually rigid), flat, rectangular measuring or drawing device with graduations in units of measurement; a straightedge with markings.
A person who rules or governs; someone or something that exercises dominion or controlling power over others.

verbs.description: ruler (third-person singular simple present rulers, present participle rulering, simple past and past participle rulered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To beat with a ruler (as a traditional school punishment).
